The Tier of the Sku.
The name of the project.

metadata.name: CognitiveServices
metadata.description: This module deploys CognitiveServices (Microsoft.CognitiveServices/accounts) and optionally available integrations.
The kind of Cognitive Service to create. See: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/cognitive-services/create-account-bicep for available kinds.
Prefix of Resource Name. Not used if name is provided
The location into which your Azure resources should be deployed.
The name of the Cognitive Service.
The tags to apply to each resource.
A custom subdomain to reach the Cognitive Service.
The Public Network Access setting of the Cognitive Service. When false, only requests from Private Endpoints can access it.
A list of private endpoints to connect to the Cognitive Service.
The name of the SKU. Be aware that not all SKUs may be available for your Subscription. See: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/cognitiveservices/accountmanagement/resource-skus

Array of role assignment objects that contain the "roleDefinitionIdOrName" and "principalId" to define RBAC role assignments on this resource. In the roleDefinitionIdOrName attribute, provide either the display name of the role definition, or its fully qualified ID in the following format: "/providers/Microsoft.Authorization/roleDefinitions/c2f4ef07-c644-48eb-af81-4b1b4947fb11"

The type of identity used for the Cosmos DB account. The type "SystemAssigned, UserAssigned" includes both an implicitly created identity and a set of user-assigned identities. The type "None" will remove any identities from the Cosmos DB account.

The list of user-assigned managed identities. The user identity dictionary key references will be ARM resource ids in the form: "/subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/resourceGroups/{resourceGroupName}/providers/Microsoft.ManagedIdentity/userAssignedIdentities/{identityName}"
Specify the type of lock on Cosmos DB account resource.
The api properties for special APIs. More info: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/templates/microsoft.cognitiveservices/accounts?pivots=deployment-language-bicep#apiproperties
Indicates whether requests using non-AAD authentication are blocked
Enables rate limiting autoscale feature. Requires paid subscription. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/cognitive-services/autoscale
The encryption settings of the Cognitive Service.
The multiregion settings of Cognitive Services account.
A collection of rules governing the accessibility from specific network locations.
The migration token for the Cognitive Service.
Specifies whether to a soft-deleted Cognitive Service should be restored. If false, the Cognitive Service needs to be purged before another with the same name can be created.

Set this to true for data loss prevention. Will block all outbound traffic except to allowedFqdnList. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/cognitive-services/cognitive-services-data-loss-prevention
List of allowed FQDNs(Fully Qualified Domain Name) for egress from the Cognitive Service.
The user owned storage accounts for the Cognitive Service.
The deployments for Cognitive Services that support them. See: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/templates/microsoft.cognitiveservices/accounts/deployments for available properties.

properties.notes: [if(equals(parameters('lock'), 'CanNotDelete'), 'Cannot delete resource or child resources.', 'Cannot modify the resource or child resources.')]

metadata.description: Resource Name
Resource Id
Endpoint

metadata._EXPERIMENTAL_WARNING: Symbolic name support in ARM is experimental, and should be enabled for testing purposes only. Do not enable this setting for any production usage, or you may be unexpectedly broken at any time!
metadata.name: Azure Storage Account
metadata.description: This Bicep module creates a Storage Account with zone-redundancy, encryption, virtual network access, and TLS version.
Indicates the duration of changeFeed retention in days. A null value indicates an infinite retention of the change feed.
The blob service properties for change feed events.

This property when set to true allows deletion of the soft deleted blob versions and snapshots. This property cannot be used blob restore policy. This property only applies to blob service and does not apply to containers or file share.
Indicates the number of days that the deleted item should be retained.
A list of headers allowed to be part of the cross-origin request.
A list of HTTP methods that are allowed to be executed by the origin.
A list of origin domains that will be allowed via CORS, or "*" to allow all domains
A list of response headers to expose to CORS clients.
The number of seconds that the client/browser should cache a preflight response.

Specifies CORS rules for the Blob service. You can include up to five CorsRule elements in the request. If no CorsRule elements are included in the request body, all CORS rules will be deleted, and CORS will be disabled for the Blob service.
The blob service property to configure last access time based tracking policy.
how long this blob can be restored. It should be great than zero and less than DeleteRetentionPolicy.days.
The blob service property to configure last access time based tracking policy.
Specifies the domain GUID.
Specifies the primary domain that the AD DNS server is authoritative for.
Specifies the Active Directory account type for Azure Storage.
Specifies the security identifier (SID) for Azure Storage.
Specifies the security identifier (SID) for domain.
Specifies the Active Directory forest to get.
Specifies the NetBIOS domain name.
Specifies the Active Directory SAMAccountName for Azure Storage.
Required if directoryServiceOptions are AD, optional if they are AADKERB.
Default share permission for users using Kerberos authentication if RBAC role is not assigned.
Indicates the directory service used. Note that this enum may be extended in the future.
Required when enable=true.
ClientId of the multi-tenant application to be used in conjunction with the user-assigned identity for cross-tenant customer-managed-keys server-side encryption on the storage account.
Resource identifier of the UserAssigned identity to be associated with server-side encryption on the storage account.
The name of KeyVault key.
The Uri of KeyVault.
The version of KeyVault key.
A boolean indicating whether or not the service encrypts the data as it is stored. Encryption at rest is enabled by default today and cannot be disabled.

Encryption key type to be used for the encryption service. "Account" key type implies that an account-scoped encryption key will be used. "Service" key type implies that a default service key is used.
The encryption function of the blob storage service.
The encryption function of the file storage service.
The encryption function of the queue storage service.
The encryption function of the table storage service.
The identity to be used with service-side encryption at rest.
Specifies the encryption keySource (provider).
Properties provided by key vault.
A boolean indicating whether or not the service applies a secondary layer of encryption with platform managed keys for data at rest.

List of services which enable encryption using customer-managed keys.
    Azure only support enabling either blob and file, queue and table, or all of them.
Specifies the resource id of the resource to which the access rule applies.
Specifies the tenant id of the resource to which the access rule applies.

Specifies whether traffic is bypassed for Logging/Metrics/AzureServices. Possible values are any combination of Logging,Metrics,AzureServices (For example, "Logging, Metrics"), or None to bypass none of those traffics.
Specifies whether all network access is allowed or denied when no other rules match.
Specifies the IP or IP range in CIDR format to be allowed to connect. Only IPV4 address is allowed.
Sets the resource access rules.
Sets the virtual network rules.
A boolean flag which indicates whether internet routing storage endpoints are to be published.
A boolean flag which indicates whether microsoft routing storage endpoints are to be published.
Routing Choice defines the kind of network routing opted by the user.

Required when enable=true
  The key expiration period in days.
The SAS expiration period, DD.HH:MM:SS.
Required when enable=true.
The name of the private endpoint.
The subnet that the private endpoint should be created in.
The subresource name of the target Azure resource that private endpoint will connect to.
The ID of the private DNS zone in which private endpoint will register its private IP address.
When set to true, users will need to manually approve the private endpoint connection request.
Tags for the resource.
The properties of a storage accounts Blob service.
A rule name can contain any combination of alpha numeric characters. Rule name is case-sensitive. It must be unique within a policy.
An object that defines the action set.
An object that defines the filter set.
An array of predefined enum values. Currently blockBlob supports all tiering and delete actions. Only delete actions are supported for appendBlob.
An array of strings for prefixes to be match.
An array of blob index tag based filters, there can be at most 10 tag filters
This is the filter tag name, it can have 1 - 128 characters
This is the comparison operator which is used for object comparison and filtering. Only == (equality operator) is currently supported
This is the filter tag value field used for tag based filtering, it can have 0 - 256 characters.
The management policy action for base blob.
The management policy action for snapshot.
The management policy action for version.
The function to delete the blob snapshot/version.
Value indicating the age in days after creation.

Value indicating the age in days after last blob tier change time. This property is only applicable for tierToArchive actions and requires daysAfterCreationGreaterThan to be set for snapshots and blob version based actions. The blob will be archived if both the conditions are satisfied.
This property enables auto tiering of a blob from cool to hot on a blob access. This property requires tierToCool.daysAfterLastAccessTimeGreaterThan.
Value indicating the age in days after blob creation.
Value indicating the age in days after last blob access. This property can only be used in conjunction with last access time tracking policy.

Value indicating the age in days after last blob tier change time. This property is only applicable for tierToArchive actions and requires daysAfterModificationGreaterThan to be set for baseBlobs based actions. The blob will be archived if both the conditions are satisfied.
Value indicating the age in days after last modification.
The value of the policy ID returned from the matching policy of the destination account.
The ID of the destination storage account.
The ID of the source storage account.
The values of the rule IDs returned from the matching policy of the destination account.
Destination container name.
Source container name.
Destination container name.
Source container name.
Filters the results to replicate only blobs whose names begin with the specified prefix..

Blobs created after the time will be replicated to the destination.
  It must be in datetime format "yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ". Example: 2020-02-19T16:05:00Z.
Description of role assignment.
The role definition ID, or the name of a built-in role from the list var.builtInRoles.
Id of the delegated managed identity resource.
Description of role assignment.
The role definition ID, or the name of a built-in role from the list var.builtInRoles.
Id of the delegated managed identity resource.
Deployment Location. It defaults to the location of the resource group.
Prefix of Storage Account Resource Name. This param is ignored when name is provided.
Name of Storage Account. Must be unique within Azure.
Tags to be applied to the Storage Account.
This toggle changes the default value of the sku parameter from Standard_LRS to Standard_ZRS.
Storage Account SKU.
Storage Account Kind.

The type of identity used for the storage account. The type "SystemAssigned, UserAssigned" includes both an implicitly created identity and a set of user-assigned identities. The type "None" will remove any identities from the resource.

The list of user-assigned managed identities. The user identity dictionary key references will be ARM resource ids in the form: "/subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/resourceGroups/{resourceGroupName}/providers/Microsoft.ManagedIdentity/userAssignedIdentities/{identityName}"

The access tier of the storage account, which is used for billing.
Required for storage accounts where kind = BlobStorage. The 'Premium' access tier is the default value for premium block blobs storage account type and it cannot be changed for the premium block blobs storage account type.
Allow or disallow public access to all blobs or containers in the storage account.
Replication of objects between AAD tenants is allowed or not. For this property, the default interpretation is true.
Required when enable=true.
Restrict copy to and from Storage Accounts within an AAD tenant or with Private Links to the same VNet.

Indicates whether the storage account permits requests to be authorized with the account access key via Shared Key. If false, then all requests, including shared access signatures, must be authorized with Azure Active Directory (Azure AD).
Provides the identity based authentication settings for Azure Files.
A boolean flag which indicates whether the default authentication is OAuth or not.

Allows you to specify the type of endpoint. Set this to AzureDNSZone to create a large number of accounts in a single subscription, which creates accounts in an Azure DNS Zone and the endpoint URL will have an alphanumeric DNS Zone identifier.
Encryption settings to be used for server-side encryption for the storage account.
Account HierarchicalNamespace enabled if sets to true.
Enables local users feature, if set to true.
NFS 3.0 protocol support enabled if set to true.
Enables Secure File Transfer Protocol, if set to true.
Policies for the access keys of the storage account.
Allow large file shares if sets to Enabled. It cannot be disabled once it is enabled.
Configuration for network access rules.
Network routing choice for data transfer.
SasPolicy assigned to the storage account.
Allows https traffic only to storage service if sets to true.
Allow or disallow public network access to Storage Account. Value is optional but if passed in, must be Enabled or Disabled.
Set the minimum TLS version to be permitted on requests to storage. The default interpretation is TLS 1.0 for this property.
Private Endpoints that should be created for the storage account.
Properties object for a Blob service of a Storage Account.
Array of blob containers to be created for blobServices of Storage Account.
Configuration for the blob inventory policy.

Configure object replication on a source storage accounts.
This config only applies to the current storage account managed by this module.

Configure object replication on a destination storage accounts.
This config only applies to the current storage account managed by this module.

Array of role assignment objects with Storage Account scope that contain the 'roleDefinitionIdOrName', 'principalId' and 'principalType' to define RBAC role assignments on that resource. In the roleDefinitionIdOrName attribute, you can provide either the display name of the role definition, or its fully qualified ID in the following format: '/providers/Microsoft.Authorization/roleDefinitions/c2f4ef07-c644-48eb-af81-4b1b4947fb11'

Array of role assignment objects with blobServices/containers scope that contain the 'containerName', 'roleDefinitionIdOrName', 'principalId' and 'principalType' to define RBAC role assignments on that resource. In the roleDefinitionIdOrName attribute, you can provide either the display name of the role definition, or its fully qualified ID in the following format: '/providers/Microsoft.Authorization/roleDefinitions/c2f4ef07-c644-48eb-af81-4b1b4947fb11'

storageAccount.name: [parameters('name')]
storageAccount.properties: [union(createObject('accessTier', if(variables('isPremium'), 'Premium', parameters('accessTier')), 'allowBlobPublicAccess', parameters('allowBlobPublicAccess'), 'allowCrossTenantReplication', parameters('allowCrossTenantReplication'), 'allowSharedKeyAccess', parameters('allowSharedKeyAccess'), 'defaultToOAuthAuthentication', parameters('defaultToOAuthAuthentication'), 'dnsEndpointType', parameters('dnsEndpointType'), 'isHnsEnabled', parameters('enableHns'), 'isLocalUserEnabled', parameters('enableLocalUser'), 'isNfsV3Enabled', parameters('enableNfsV3'), 'isSftpEnabled', parameters('enableSftp'), 'largeFileSharesState', if(parameters('enablelargeFileShares'), 'Enabled', 'Disabled'), 'minimumTlsVersion', parameters('minimumTlsVersion'), 'networkAcls', variables('varNetworkAcls'), 'publicNetworkAccess', if(parameters('enablePublicNetworkAccess'), 'Enabled', 'Disabled'), 'routingPreference', parameters('routingPreference'), 'supportsHttpsTrafficOnly', parameters('supportHttpsTrafficOnly')), if(parameters('allowedCopyScope').enable, createObject('allowedCopyScope', parameters('allowedCopyScope').scope), createObject()), if(parameters('encryption').enable, createObject('encryption', parameters('encryption').configurations), createObject()), if(parameters('accessKeyPolicy').enable, createObject('keyPolicy', parameters('accessKeyPolicy').keyExpirationPeriodInDays), createObject()), if(parameters('sasTokenPolicy').enable, createObject('sasPolicy', parameters('sasTokenPolicy').configurations), createObject()), if(parameters('azureFilesIdentityBasedAuthentication').enable, createObject('azureFilesIdentityBasedAuthentication', parameters('azureFilesIdentityBasedAuthentication').configurations), createObject()))]

metadata.name: Container Registry
metadata.description: This module deploys Container Registry (Microsoft.ContainerRegistry/registries) and optionally available integrations.
The name of the Azure Container Registry.
Location for all resources.
Tags for all resource(s).
The SKU of the Azure Container Registry.
Toggle the Azure Container Registry admin user.
Toggle public network access to Azure Container Registry.
When public network access is disabled, toggle this to allow Azure services to bypass the public network access rule.
A list of IP or IP ranges in CIDR format, that should be allowed access to Azure Container Registry.
The default action to take when no network rule match is found for accessing Azure Container Registry.

Array of role assignment objects that contain the 'roleDefinitionIdOrName'(string) and 'principalIds'(array of strings) to define RBAC role assignments on this resource. In the roleDefinitionIdOrName attribute, you can provide either the display name of the role definition, or its fully qualified ID in the following format: '/providers/Microsoft.Authorization/roleDefinitions/c2f4ef07-c644-48eb-af81-4b1b4947fb11'
Specify the type of lock.
Define Private Endpoints that should be created for Azure Container Registry.
Toggle if Private Endpoints manual approval for Azure Container Registry should be enabled.
Toggle if Zone Redundancy should be enabled on Azure Container Registry.
Array of Azure Location configurations that this Azure Container Registry should replicate too.
Toggle if a single data endpoint per region for serving data from Azure Container Registry should be enabled.
Toggle if encryption should be enabled on Azure Container Registry.
Toggle if export policy should be enabled on Azure Container Registry.
Toggle if quarantine policy should be enabled on Azure Container Registry.
Toggle if retention policy should be enabled on Azure Container Registry.
Configure the retention policy in days for Azure Container Registry. Only effective is 'retentionPolicyEnabled' is 'true'.
Toggle if trust policy should be enabled on Azure Container Registry.
The client ID of the identity which will be used to access Key Vault.
The Key Vault URI to access the encryption key.
Specifies the number of days that logs will be kept for; a value of 0 will retain data indefinitely.
Resource ID of the diagnostic storage account.
Resource ID of the diagnostic log analytics workspace.
Resource ID of the diagnostic event hub authorization rule for the Event Hubs namespace in which the event hub should be created or streamed to.
Name of the diagnostic event hub within the namespace to which logs are streamed. Without this, an event hub is created for each log category.
The name of logs that will be streamed.
The name of metrics that will be streamed.
Optional. The list of ACR tasks to create.

properties.encryption: [if(variables('IS_PREMIUM_SKU'), if(parameters('encryptionEnabled'), createObject('keyVaultProperties', createObject('identity', parameters('encryptionKeyVaultIdentity'), 'keyIdentifier', parameters('encryptionKeyVaultKeyIdentifier')), 'status', 'enabled'), null()), null())]
